DOC.brief_summary: The primary objective study evaluate safety tolerability GS-9674 adult primary biliary cholangitis ( PBC ) .
DOC.brief_title: Safety , Tolerability , Efficacy GS 9674 Adults With Primary Biliary Cholangitis Without Cirrhosis
DOC.criteria: Key Meets follow condition Definite probable PBC define least 2 3 follow criterion : Serum alkaline phosphatase ( ALP ) > upper limit normal ( ULN ) Presence antimitochondrial antibody ( AMA ) serum ( ≥ 1:40 immunofluorescence ) Liver histological ( base liver biopsy ) finding consistent PBC include nonsuppurative , destructive cholangitis affect mainly interlobular bile septal bile duct Serum ALP > 1.67 x ULN and/or total bilirubin > ULN ≤ 2 x ULN Ursodeoxycholic acid ( UDCA ) use stable dose least 12 month intolerant UDCA UDCA use least 12 month screen Screening FibroSURE/FibroTest® < 0.75 unless historical liver biopsy within 12 month screen reveal cirrhosis . In adult Gilbert 's syndrome hemolysis , FibroSURE/FibroTest® use direct bilirubin instead total bilirubin . Key Alanine aminotransferase ( ALT ) > 5 x ULN Total bilirubin > 2 x ULN International normalize ratio ( INR ) > 1.2 unless anticoagulant therapy Other cause liver disease include viral , metabolic , alcoholic , autoimmune condition . Participants hepatic steatosis may include evidence nonalcoholic steatohepatitis ( NASH ) opinion investigator liver biopsy . Use fibrates obeticholic acid within 3 month prior screen end treatment Cirrhosis liver define follow : Historical liver biopsy demonstrate cirrhosis ( eg , Ludwig stage 4 Ishak stage ≥ 5 ) History decompensated liver disease , include ascites , hepatic encephalopathy variceal bleed Liver stiffness > 16.9 kPa FibroScan Note : Other protocol define Inclusion/Exclusion criterion may apply .
